title: Accessibility in UI Design
excerpt: Designing interfaces that are usable by people with diverse abilities.
content:
Accessibility in UI design ensures that interfaces can be used by people with a wide range of abilities, including those with visual, auditory, motor, or cognitive disabilities.

Key Principles

  • Perceivable: Information must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive
  • Operable: Interface components must be operable by all users
  • Understandable: Information and operation must be understandable
  • Robust: Content must be robust enough to be interpreted by a wide variety of user agents

Best Practices

  1. Use sufficient color contrast for text and important elements
  2. Provide text alternatives for non-text content
  3. Ensure keyboard navigation for all functionality
  4. Use semantic HTML to structure your content
  5. Design focus indicators for interactive elements
  6. Provide captions and transcripts for multimedia content
